item_prototype.name: bdev-cache_mode-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: cache_mode Can be one of either writethrough, writeback, writearound or none

item_prototype.name: bdev-dirty_data-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: dirty_data Amount of dirty data for this backing device in the cache. Continuously updated unlike the cache set's version, but may be slightly off.

item_prototype.name: bdev-running-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: running 1 if bcache is running (i.e. whether the /dev/bcache device exists, whether it's in passthrough mode or caching).

item_prototype.name: bdev-state-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description:
state The backing device can be in one of four different states:
no cache: Has never been attached to a cache set.
clean: Part of a cache set, and there is no cached dirty data.
dirty: Part of a cache set, and there is cached dirty data.
inconsistent: The backing device was forcibly run by the user when there was dirty data cached but the cache set was unavailable; whatever data was on the backing device has likely been corrupted.

item_prototype.name: bdev-stats_5min-cache_hit_ratio-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: cache_hit_ratio Hits and misses are counted per individual IO as bcache sees them; a partial hit is counted as a miss.

item_prototype.name: bdev-stats_day-cache_hit_ratio-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: cache_hit_ratio Hits and misses are counted per individual IO as bcache sees them; a partial hit is counted as a miss.

item_prototype.name: bdev-stats_hour-cache_hit_ratio-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: cache_hit_ratio Hits and misses are counted per individual IO as bcache sees them; a partial hit is counted as a miss.

item_prototype.name: bdev-stats_total-cache_hit_ratio-{#BBDEV}
item_prototype.description: cache_hit_ratio Hits and misses are counted per individual IO as bcache sees them; a partial hit is counted as a miss.

trigger_prototype.name: Bcache bdev {#BBDEV} not in Write-Back mode

item_prototype.name: cdev-btree_written-{#BCDEV}
item_prototype.description: Sum of all btree writes, in (kilo/mega/giga) byte

item_prototype.name: cdev-io_errors-{#BCDEV}
item_prototype.description: Number of errors that have occurred, decayed by io_error_halflife

item_prototype.name: cdev-metadata_written-{#BCDEV}
item_prototype.description: Sum of all non data writes (btree writes and all other metadata).

item_prototype.name: cdev-written-{#BCDEV}
item_prototype.description: Sum of all data that has been written to the cache; comparison with btree_written gives the amount of write inflation in bcache.

item_prototype.name: cset-average_key_size-{#BCSET}
item_prototype.description: Average data per key in the btree.

item_prototype.name: cset-btree_cache_size-{#BCSET}
item_prototype.description: Amount of memory currently used by the btree cache

item_prototype.name: cset-cache_available_percent-{#BCSET}
item_prototype.description: Percentage of cache device which doesn't contain dirty data, and could potentially be used for writeback. This doesn't mean this space isn't used for clean cached data; the unused statistic (in priority_stats) is typically much lower.
